title: Tuscany Movie Towns
text:
• Florence - Tea With Mussolini and A Room With a View 
The charming 1999 Franco Zeffirelli film, Tea with Mussolini , has many good shots of Florence's top sights. It takes place in the 1930's and stars Maggie Smith, Lily Tomlin, and Cher. Another older, charming movie with scenes set in Florence and the nearby countryside is A Room with a View . 
First time visitors to Florence sometimes don't realize that the popular city is actually part of the Tuscany region. Several Tuscan towns can be visited as day trips from Florence . More » The Tuscan Hill Town of Volterra. James Martin, Europe Travel • Volterra - Twilight Saga New Moon 
The medieval hill town of Volterra is the home of the Volturi in the New Moon book, the second book in the Twilight series, and several sites from the story can be seen in town. The Volturi , a coven of vampires, enforce the laws of the vampire world and keep vampires hidden from humans. At the end of the story, Edward and Bella come to Volterra. However the ending of the movie was actually filmed in another Tuscan town, Montepulciano . 
Volterra's sights go back as far as the Etruscan period and include a Roman theater, an impressive medieval main square, and Romanesque Cathedral. More » Dirt Road in Carrara Marble Quarries. © by Martha Bakerjian • Carrara Marble Quarries - Quantum Solace 
A chase scene from the James Bond movie, Quantum Solace, takes place in the marble quarries of Carrara. Several Austin Martin's went over the cliff during the filming of the movie and you can see the movie location on a jeep tour at the Fantiscritti Marble Quarries . 
The marble quarries of Carrara, in northern Tuscany, have been used for marble since Roman times and Michelangelo got some of his marble from these quarries, too. More » Pinocchio House at Castelfalfi. by James Martin, Europe Travel • Castelfalfi - Pinocchio 
A little house on the estate of Castelfalfi Resort was used in filming the Roberto Benigni version of Pinocchio. Castelfalfi is an abandoned medieval village that has been restored and transformed into a vacation resort with hotel, apartments, and villas. The estate includes vineyards, a game preserve, castle, and 27-hole golf course. More » • Sant' Anna di Stazemma - Miracle at St Anna 
The Spike Lee movie depicts the horrors of one of the atrocious massacres of World War II that took place in the isolated mountain village of Sant' Anna di Stazemma . Germans killed more than 500 civilians in the village in retaliation for acts of sabotage committed by the resistance movement. 
Sant'Anna di Stazemma is a peaceful town above the art town of Pietrasanta , reached by a steep, twisty road. In the town is a memorial in the Peace Park, parish church, and the Historical Museum of the Resistance. More » Related Articles
